Documentation.long_help: This filter lets the user select coasts from the coasts mask.
Documentation.short_help: Lets the user select coasts from the coasts mask.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: mask_field
StringVectorProperty.label: Coast mask:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Name of the coast mask field

StringVectorProperty.name: CoastsStatus
StringVectorProperty.label: Mediterranean Sea
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains a list of the coasts of the Mediterranean Sea.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation (defaulted to 0.5 and 1).

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then a cell is only included in the output if the value of the selected array for all its points is within the threshold. This is only relevant when thresholding by a point-centered array.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseContinuousCellRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If off, the vertex scalars are treated as a discrete set. If on, they are treated as a continuous interval over the minimum and maximum. One important "on" use case: When setting lower and upper threshold equal to some value and turning AllScalars off, the results are cells containing the isosurface for that value. WARNING: Whether on or off, for higher order input, the filter will not give accurate results.

Documentation.long_help: This filter lets the user select basins from the basins mask.
Documentation.short_help: Lets the user select basins from the basins mask.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: mask_field
StringVectorProperty.label: Basins mask:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Name of the basins mask field

StringVectorProperty.name: BasinsStatus
StringVectorProperty.label: Mediterranean Sea
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains a list of the sub-basins of the Mediterranean Sea.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

IntVectorProperty.name: basins_field
IntVectorProperty.label: Output basins field
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Output a field to visualize the basins.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation (defaulted to 0.5 and 1).

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then a cell is only included in the output if the value of the selected array for all its points is within the threshold. This is only relevant when thresholding by a point-centered array.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseContinuousCellRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If off, the vertex scalars are treated as a discrete set. If on, they are treated as a continuous interval over the minimum and maximum. One important "on" use case: When setting lower and upper threshold equal to some value and turning AllScalars off, the results are cells containing the isosurface for that value. WARNING: Whether on or off, for higher order input, the filter will not give accurate results.

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars

SourceProxy.name: OGSSelectOkuboWeiss
SourceProxy.label: OGS Select Okubo-Weiss

Documentation.long_help: This filter lets the user select the Okubo-Weiss regions from the Okubo-Weiss mask.
Documentation.short_help: Lets the user select the Okubo-Weiss regions from the Okubo-Weiss mask.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Re-implementation of the vtkThreshold to use the Okubo-Weiss mask and select the Okubo-Weiss regions once the Okubo-Weiss criterion has been computed.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: mask_field
StringVectorProperty.label: Okubo-Weiss mask:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Name of the Okubo-Weiss mask field

StringVectorProperty.name: OWStatus
StringVectorProperty.label: Mediterranean Sea
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains a list of the Okubo-Weiss regions of the Mediterranean Sea.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation (defaulted to 0.5 and 1).

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then a cell is only included in the output if the value of the selected array for all its points is within the threshold. This is only relevant when thresholding by a point-centered array.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseContinuousCellRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If off, the vertex scalars are treated as a discrete set. If on, they are treated as a continuous interval over the minimum and maximum. One important "on" use case: When setting lower and upper threshold equal to some value and turning AllScalars off, the results are cells containing the isosurface for that value. WARNING: Whether on or off, for higher order input, the filter will not give accurate results.

Documentation.long_help: This filter lets the user select using a polygon from bit.sea.
Documentation.short_help: Lets the user select using a polygon.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Points
StringVectorProperty.label: Polygon points:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation:
Point list in the form of:
Latitude Longitude
A whitespace " " is needed to separate both magnitudes. The polygon point order must be set accordingly. Handles directly the output from bit.sea/poly_selector.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation (defaulted to 0.5 and 1).

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then a cell is only included in the output if the value of the selected array for all its points is within the threshold. This is only relevant when thresholding by a point-centered array.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseContinuousCellRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If off, the vertex scalars are treated as a discrete set. If on, they are treated as a continuous interval over the minimum and maximum. One important "on" use case: When setting lower and upper threshold equal to some value and turning AllScalars off, the results are cells containing the isosurface for that value. WARNING: Whether on or off, for higher order input, the filter will not give accurate results.

SourceProxy.name: OGSSelectTimePeriod
SourceProxy.label: OGS Select Time Period

Documentation.long_help: This plugin selects a range of time from the whole timestep of the simulation.
Documentation.short_help: Selects a range of time from the whole timestep of the simulation.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Given a time requestor, this filter selects a range of time from the whole timestep of the simulation.

StringVectorProperty.name: StartTime
StringVectorProperty.label: Start Time:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the initial timestep for the TimeInterval.

StringVectorProperty.name: EndTime
StringVectorProperty.label: End Time:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the final timestep for the TimeInterval.
